subject: Career
title: Never Say Yes to the First Offer
description: One-minute skill: Never Say Yes to the First Offer.

hook.text: The offer sounds great. Your instinct says take it. But accepting instantly leaves money on the table.

buildup.text: First offers are rarely final offers. There's almost always a range with room above.

discovery.text: Even a simple 'Is there flexibility?' can unlock 5-15% more without any hardball.

twist.text: Accepting too fast also signals low expectations. It can make the employer wonder if they overpaid.

climax.text: Say: 'I'm excited about this. Let me review the full package and follow up tomorrow.'

punchline.text: Pause. Review. Then respond. Never on the spot.

quiz.question: Why shouldn't you accept the first salary offer immediately?
options: There's usually a range with room above
